subject: Communication
title: Listening Across Generations
description: A fast breakdown of Listening Across Generations for builders.

hook.text: 'Kids these days don't listen.' 'Boomers never hear us.' Every generation says this.

buildup.text: Different generations have different communication norms: formality levels, preferred channels, feedback expectations.

discovery.text: Gen Z prefers text and visual communication. Boomers prefer face-to-face.

twist.text: Research shows generational stereotypes are mostly overblown.

climax.text: Cross-generational listening requires curiosity, not assumptions. Ask 'how do you prefer to communicate?

punchline.text: Generations don't have ears. People do. Listen to the person, not the label.

quiz.question: What does research show about generational communication differences?
options: Within-generation variation is larger than between-generation differences
